stories.text:
The LODA project is looking for compute resources to extend their distributed mining. The goal of the project is to generate assembly programs that calculate integer sequences from the OEIS (On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences).

The miner is a command-line tool available for Ubuntu, macOS and Windows. There is a Grafana dashboard showing the current results of all miners. If you run a miner, you can enter your name to be included in mined programs.

Project website with links to Mining Dashboard, Installation and more:

https://loda-lang.org/
stories.title: Call for Compute Resources: Mining Integer Sequence Programs with LODA
Why do Android phones use hundreds of times less power than an SBC? (2019)

stories.text:
I’m looking for a way to verify the sender of an email by the recipient that is easy use by non-technical users and is cross platform.

Using something like GPG email signing is not something I can ask our accounting or marketing team to reliably and securely do on their own (especially when everyone is working remotely).
stories.title: Ask HN: What’s the best way to authenticate email senders
